text: Lucien Magne (December 27, 1849 - July 25, 1916) was a French architect specialising in religious buildings. He took a large part in the completion of the Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Montmartre on the death of Paul Abadie (1884). He created the stained glass museum of the Trocadéro. == References == Category:1849 births Category:1916 deaths Category:Architects from Paris Category:Alumni of the École des Beaux-Arts Category:19th-century French architects Category:French art historians
title: Lucien Magne
